PUBLICATIONS

    Qi Yu, Fabian Schlotterbeck, Hening Wang, Naomi Reichmann, Britta Stolterfoht, Regine Eckardt and Miriam Butt. 2024 (to appear). Ad Hoc Compounds for Stance Detection. To appear in Proceedings of the Joint Workshop on Multiword Expressions and Universal Dependencies (MWE-UD 2024).
    Sergio E. Zanotto, Qi Yu, Miriam Butt and Diego Frassinelli. 2024 (to appear). GRIT: A Dataset of Group Reference Recognition in Italian. To appear in Proceedings of the 2024 Joint International Conference on Computational Linguistics, Language Resources and Evaluation.
    Hyewon Jang♥, Qi Yu♥ and Diego Frassinelli. 2023. Figurative Language Processing: A Linguistically Informed Feature Analysis of the Behavior of Language Models and Humans. Findings of the Association for Computational Linguistics: ACL 2023.
    ♥: co-first authors; listed alphabetically
    Qi Yu. 2023. Towards a More In-Depth Detection of Political Framing. Proceedings of the 7th Joint SIGHUM Workshop on Computational Linguistics for Cultural Heritage, Social Sciences, Humanities and Literature (LaTeCH-CLfL2023).
    Qi Yu. 2022. "Again, Dozens of Refugees Drowned": A Computational Study of Political Framing Evoked by Presuppositions. Proceedings of the 2022 Conference of the North American Chapter of the Association for Computational Linguistics: Human Language Technologies: Student Research Workshop.
    Qi Yu and Anselm Fliethmann. 2022. Frame Detection in German Political Discourses: How Far Can We Go Without Large-Scale Manual Corpus Annotation?. Journal for Language Technology and Computational Linguistics, 35(2): 15–31.
    Qi Yu, Aikaterini-Lida Kalouli and Diego Frassinelli. 2021. KonTra at CMCL 2021 Shared Task: Predicting Eye Movements by Combining BERT with Surface, Linguistic and Behavioral Information. Proceedings of the Workshop on Cognitive Modeling and Computational Linguistics.
    Regine Eckardt and Qi Yu. 2020. German bloß Questions as Extreme Ignorance Questions. Linguistica Brunensia, 68(1): 7-22.

TALKS AND POSTERS

    Qi Yu. 2024. German Modal Particles: A Lens on Framing at the Non-Propositional Level. 46th Annual Conference of the German Linguistic Society (DGfS 2024). February 28 - March 01, Ruhr University Bochum, Germany.
    Regine Eckardt and Qi Yu. 2024. Innovated Compounds, Concepts, and Prototypes: A Road to Framing. 46th Annual Conference of the German Linguistic Society (DGfS 2024). February 28 - March 01, Ruhr University Bochum, Germany.
    Qi Yu, Fabian Schlotterbeck, Regine Eckardt, and Britta Stolterfoht. 2022. An experimental study on ad hoc compounds in political discourse. 9th Experimental Pragmatics Conference (XPRAG 2022). September 22-23, IUSS Pavia, Italy.
    Regine Eckardt and Qi Yu. 2022. Stance marking and register differences in newspaper articles. Workshop "Metaphors and stance markers in register variation (MeStaR)". June 16-17. Humboldt University of Berlin, Germany.
    Qi Yu and Regine Eckardt. 2022. Enigmatic Compounds: How They Act as Source of Attitudinal Meaning. Workshop "Literal and Figurative Meanings of Compounds". Februrary 23-25. University of Tübingen, Germany.
    Qi Yu. 2021. Compound-Coinages as Sources of Attitudinal Meaning. 17th International Pragmatics Conference (IPrA). June 27-July 2. Zurich University of Applied Sciences, Switzerland.
    Regine Eckardt and Qi Yu. 2020. Enigmatic Compounds as Probes of Common Ground: BILD and Other Media. Workshop "Common Ground in Literary Communication”. November 20. University of Tübingen, Germany.
    Regine Eckardt and Qi Yu. 2019. It's Domain Widening Yet: German nur/bloß as a Marker of Extreme Ignorance Questions. Semantics and Philosophy in Europe (SPE) 11. September 20-22. University of Warsaw, Poland.
